Exceptions.h

00001 #ifndef _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00002 #define _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00003 
00004 #include <exception>
00005 #include <string>
00006 #include <sstream>
00007 
00008 /**
00009  * @defgroup Exceptions Exceptions
00010  */
00011 
00012 namespace Passenger {
00013 
00014 using namespace std;
00015 
00016 /**
00017  * Represents an error returned by a system call or a standard library call.
00018  *
00019  * Use the code() method to find out the value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time
00020  * the error occured.
00021  *
00022  * @ingroup Exceptions
00023  */
00024 class SystemException: public exception {
00025 private:
00026         string shortMessage;
00027         string fullMessage;
00028         int m_code;
00029 public:
00030         /**
00031          * Create a new SystemException.
00032          *
00033          * @param message A message describing the error.
00034          * @param errorCode The error code, i.e. the value of errno right after the error occured.
00035          * @note A system description of the error will be appended to the given message.
00036          *    For example, if <tt>errorCode</tt> is <tt>EBADF</tt>, and <tt>message</tt>
00037          *    is <em>"Something happened"</em>, then what() will return <em>"Something happened: Bad
00038          *    file descriptor (10)"</em> (if 10 is the number for EBADF).
00039          * @post code() == errorCode
00040          * @post brief() == message
00041          */
00042         SystemException(const string &message, int errorCode) {
00043                 stringstream str;
00044                 shortMessage = message;
00045                 str << message << ": " << strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")";
00046                 fullMessage = str.str();
00047                 m_code = errorCode;
00048         }
00049         
00050         virtual ~SystemException() throw() {}
00051         
00052         virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00053                 return fullMessage.c_str();
00054         }
00055         
00056         /**
00057          * The value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time the error occured.
00058          */
00059         int code() const throw() {
00060                 return m_code;
00061         }
00062         
00063         /**
00064          * A brief version of the exception message. This message does
00065          * not include the system error description, and is equivalent to the
00066          * value of the <tt>message</tt> parameter as passed to the constructor.
00067          */
00068         string brief() const throw() {
00069                 return shortMessage;
00070         }
00071 };
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Represents an out-of-memory error.
00075  *
00076  * @ingroup Exceptions
00077  */
00078 class MemoryException: public exception {
00079 private:
00080         string message;
00081 public:
00082         MemoryException(): message("Unable to allocate memory.") {}
00083         
00084         MemoryException(const string &msg): message(msg) {}
00085         
00086         virtual ~MemoryException() throw() {}
00087         
00088         virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00089                 return message.c_str();
00090         }
00091 };
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * Represents an error that occured during an I/O operation.
00095  *
00096  * @ingroup Exceptions
00097  */
00098 class IOException: public exception {
00099 private:
00100         string msg;
00101 public:
00102         IOException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00103         virtual ~IOException() throw() {}
00104         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00105 };
00106 
00107 } // namespace Passenger
00108 
00109 #endif /* _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_ */
